I wish Luis Alvarez could have lived to see the House pass this legislation today. Let the Senate act in concert with the House now to honor his sacrifice, his service and his cause. #Renew911VCF

Mr. Alvarez mobilized his energy to give righteous voice to 9/11 first responders increasingly bewildered & outraged by the lethargic response of the gov/t to their suffering. He was a public servant, fighter & citizen who challenged indifference & injustice until the very end.

Many who worked at Ground Zero now suffer from serious 9/11-related illnesses & many ‚Äì like first responder Luis Alvarez ‚Äì died as a result of such illnesses. I did not know Luis Alvarez but I witnessed his powerful & unforgettable testimony when he came before @HouseJudiciary.

In the days, weeks and months following the September 11, 2001 terror attacks, America saw firefighters, rescue workers and first responders ‚Äì from the local New York area and from across the country ‚Äì go to Ground Zero to do the dangerous work of debris removal and clean-up.

The House just passed the bill to #Renew911VCF by a vote of 402-12! Proud to be an original cosponsor of this legislation to provide long overdue financial security & support that our 9/11 first responders, survivors, and families deserve. https://raskin.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-raskin-votes-pass-permanent-reauthorization-september-11th-victim?fbclid=IwAR3MVZbmA5yOBs4ZRYIzejKesTvl39pMH28cNOSZJJpZl_JHlBJkLDxlGJQ¬†‚Ä¶
